dialogues.text: Do you have my money?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I’ve given you four-hundred thousand already. How much more are you going to need?

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: As much as it takes. Powell sighs out loud... irritated.

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First the nose... Powell turns around and there is now BLOOD GUSHING from h nose...

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTCN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then the ears... BLOOD begins to ooze from both ears... as he covers his face... feeling the warm fluid rush from every orifice...

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then the eyes...  80. Blood rushes from beneath his eyelids... his entire face covered in BLOOD... his WHITE SHIRT DRENCHED...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Please! I’ve got it right here! Powell reaches beneath his desk and retrieves a large priefcase. He places it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's all there! Two-hundred thousand! You can count it if you want!

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Bud... Bud grabs the briefcase from the desk and pops it open. H sees that it is filled with stacks of cash.

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You tell that sniper you have perched on that roof next door that I can smell his cheap cologne. _ Ext. RICHMOND ROOFTOP -- NEXT The SNIPER hears Arlington's VOICE in his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON, (EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: I think it might be Old Spice. The Sniper smells his shoulder. INT. POWELL’S OFFICE -- RECEPTION -~ NEXT Arlington and Bud move through the reception area. The Receptionist lurks behind her desk... frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma are standing in a WAITING ROOM in the ch where her sister is about to be married. BRIDESMAIDS and GROOMSMEN are chatting with one another in anticipation o the ceremony. Norma clutches the copy of No Exit.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You and Walter were there in the room. You were wearing a black dress, identical to the one you have on now. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ERTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Walter had a blindfold on. (beat) And then your eyes...

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: They didn’t have lids...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I had the same dream. Arthur's mind is racing... he glances through the crowd nervously, afraid that they are being watched.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What's the last thing you remember?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: The library. He was asking me all of these questions... about you... about our marriage. (beat) Then I took his hand... Susan approaches...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Alright girls... time to line up! Susan hands Arthur the book and goes off with the other BRIDESMAIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma stands next to Deborah as she is about to take her vows.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: Do you, Deborah Burns, take Edward Powell, to be your’ lawfully wedded husband, ‘til death do you part?

dialogues.speaker: DEBORAH
dialogues.text: I do. Norma looks over to Arthur, as he sits in the congregatio He is not paying attention to the wedding. He is reading Sartre's play... The CAMERA zooms into a close-up of the page describing t final scene in the play No Exit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTELLE: [with a peal of laughter]: Forever. My God, how funny! Forever. GARCIN: [looks over at the two women, and joins in the laughter]: For ever, and ever, and ever. INSERT: Arthur‘s eyes... reading...

dialogues.speaker: PAGE
dialogues.text: [They slump onto their respective sofas. A long silence. Their laughter dies away and they gaze at each other.] GARCIN: Well, well, let’s get on with it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WEDDING PARTY comes pouring out of the church. There massive LAWN south of the entrance. During the holidays i filled with CHRISTMAS TREES for sale, and dozens of ARTS CRAFTS BOOTHS assembled in rows. The CAMERA moves through the crowd to find Norma posing f photos with her fellow bridesmaids out in front of the square. ACROSS THE SQUARE... Bud Wall lurks within the rows of Christmas Trees. He spies Arthur and Walter mingling with parents and Senator Powell, who has TWO SECRET SERVICEMEN standing close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA approaches the driveway of the VIRGINIA HOUSE. which is positioned at the south end of Forest Lawn squar Wedding guests are arriving in droves. The house is a large GOTHIC MANSION that is often rented for public events... and in this case... for the lavish WEDDING RECEPTION of Deborah Burns and Edward Powell.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, VIRGINIA HOUSE
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma move through the courtyard into the wedd reception area... which flows through several TENTS that been erected with HEAT LAMPS and tables covered in WHITE TABLECLOTHS and FLORAL ARRANGEMENTS. Arthur carries the copy of No Exit with hin.  €3.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: The play tells the story of =hree people, condemned to hell. They are to remain in a second empire drawing room for all of eternity. He closes the book... his mind dissecting what he has jus read.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They soon discover that their eyelids are missing... and for all eternity they will be unable to sleep. Norma remembers most of the play from high school.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: There are no mirrors... so they will never be able to see their own reflection... but only the faces of their tormentors.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: This is Sartre’s vision of hell.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Because Hell... is other people. The look into one another’s eyes... Norma sees a WAITER p by with a tray of CHAMPAGNE. They both take a glass. Jim crosses the lawn to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Arthur... can I speak with you privately for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Sure. Arthur walks away with Jim toward the edge of a PATIO tha overlooks the whole party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Arthur stand at a table. Jim has several PHOTOGRA laid out on the table. They are mostly family photos take from the house of Robert Bevilacqua.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: And do you know this fella? Robert Bevilacqua?  84.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah... I know him. He works at NASA.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Do you know his wife?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEUR
dialogues.text: Nowe

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Well... he shot and killed his wife yesterday morning.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Nowe

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Yeah... He shot her point blank in the chest in his kitchen. Arthur takes a deep breath. He isn’t feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This Bevilacqua fella... if he tries to contact you or Norma... you have to call me immediately, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. Arthur looks down at the lawn. Norma is staring back at t

dialogues.speaker: EXT, VIRGINIA HOUSE
dialogues.text: Norma is now standing up on stage with a MICROPHONE in he hand... giving her MAID OF HONOR speech.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: My little sister once asked me... what's the best thing about being married? Norma looks across the lawn to the table where Arthur is seated, next to Walter and their parents.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told her that... it’s knowing that for the rest of your life you'll never feel alone. (beat) Not ever again. She smiles at her husband.  85.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is... until you get divorced. There is laughter from the crowd. Deborah blushes... lean her head on her new husband’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or... until he decides to kill you. More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma are now slow dancing.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Why did you say that?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA,
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: In your speech. That joke about me killing you.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA,
dialogues.text: I don't know... I thought it was funny. Guess I’ve had too much champagne.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Did your dad tell you about Robert Bevilacqua?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: He shot his wife yesterday morning. Did you know his wife?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: No. Norma is still searching for some other explanation.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if it’s all a test for the aspiring astronauts?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  86.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: A psychological test. They want to see how you’li respond to a moral dilemma... the fate of a human life... determined by the push of a single button. Think of the men on the Apollo thirteen mission... sound familiar? They turn slowly on the dance floor... Arthur closes his eyes... his mind racing... A VOICE breaks through the music...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: May I cut in? Arthur and Norma turn to see a MAN standing there... It is DR. EARL STUPE.

dialogues.speaker: STUPE
dialogues.text: I would like to dance with your wife. Do you mind? Arthur glares at Dr. Stupe.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: It’s okay Arthur... Arthur looks at him... then back at Norma. His face has g pale and he looks for a moment as though he might faint o the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I... Tene (swallows hard) Will you please excuse me? Arthur moves toward the stairs that lead up to the palati estate. Walter is there... waiting.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Dad! What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I... I’m gonna be sick Walter... He places his hand on his son’s head for a brief moment a then stumbles up the stairs. ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Norma is now slow dancing with Dr. Stupe.  87.

dialogues.speaker: STUPE
dialogues.text: I know what they call me. Dr. Stupid. My patients... the ones who will still see me... they find out what I did and they stop calling.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry for that. I can’t control what people say.

dialogues.speaker: STUPE
dialogues.text: I am Dr. Stupid now. Someone wrote it on my windshield with soap once. I figure it must have been a relative... a friend of yours. (beat) Oh... how they love you, Norma Lewis. And they love your husband... the one who saved you. Did he save your life? Did he rescue you from the oblivion that I manufactured?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Yes. You have my forgiveness, Earl. People make mistakes... and if they seek forgiveness... they should be forgiven. (beat) That’s the rule of my lord. INT. VIRGINIA HOUSE -- MEN’S BATHROOM -- NEXT Arthur comes into the MEN’S BATHROOM and rushes into one the stalls. He falls to his knees... leaning over the toi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Norma notices her brother NATHAN... sitting alone at his table in his wheelchair. He is drunk lost in his own sadness. He smiles at her...

dialogues.speaker: STUPE
dialogues.text: There is that old cliche... that the lord works in mysterious ways. Well... I have met the lord. I have spoken to him in my dreams. And it brought me back to that day in my office when you arrived with a fractured foot... some thirteen years ago. (beat) He told me that it was essential... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STUPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: an essential event in the cycle of purgatory and its inevitable conclusion. Norma pulls away from him. Blood drains out of his nose..

dialogues.speaker: STUPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For when the cycle of purgatory concludes... there is nothing left put a barren wasteland of rock and sand... a deafening wind and a cold, dry winter. ABOVE... on the MARBLE RAILING... the OWL is perched on t ledge... watching... ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Stupe retrieves a PISTOL from his pocket... and raises his eyes to meet those of his dance partner.

dialogues.speaker: STUPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am sorry my dear... Stupe takes the pistol... places it against his temple... pulls the trigger. BLOOD SPRAYS across the dance floor... some of it on Norm face. PEOPLE BEGIN TO SCREAM AND THE ENTIRE WEDDING ERUPT INTO CHAOS... INT. VIRGINIA HOUSE -- MEN’S BATHROOM ~~ NEXT Arthur is now standing at the urinal. He begins to hear commotion outside. He turns his head to the left... when something COLD and METAL locks itself around his wrist. Arthur turns back to the right and sees that it is Robert Bevilacqua. He is standing at the urinal next to him and are now HAND-CUFFED TOGETHER at the wrists. Bevilacqua retrieves a GUN from his pocket at points it a Arthur. He has dark circles under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: You can still save yourself. It's too late for me... but you can still save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua...

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Follow me out through the kitchen. I have a truck waiting...  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua emerge from the men’s bathroom into hallway that leads into the kitchen. Beyond them... in th PARLOR... there is commotion among the members of the wed party in response to the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua move through the kitchen. The WAITE and WAITRESSES are all distracted by the commotion and ba take notice of them as they pass through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks down the driveway as several POLICE OFFICERS rush past him, moving toward the entrance of the house. T whole place is being evacuated... He looks toward the square... and begins to move in that direction. The CAMERA drifts back toward the ROCK PILLAR that stands the entrance to the house. Arlington is standing there in front of it. He is wearing his black hat... pulled down l He begins to follow Walter toward the square...

dialogues.speaker: EXT, VIRGINIA HOUSE
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua come out the back entrance into the driveway. There is a WHITE PICKUP TRUCK parked there. Bevilacqua opens the passenger side door and the two of t slide across the seat, Bevilacqua behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter wanders through a group of CHRISTMAS CAROLERS... moving toward the maze of CHRISTMAS TREES. He looks over shoulder... where Arlington emerges from a crowd... stari him down like a monster. Walter’s face is ghost white with terror. He begins to wa faster through the maze.  Ne 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes down the driveway with her mother and sister. overcome with shock... searching the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Walter?

dialogues.speaker: EXT, VIRGINIA HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua puts the truck into drive and speeds out of th driveway onto the street. Jim stands across the lawn, manning the chaos. He recogni the two men as the pass. him by... and he raises his WALK TALKIE to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I just spotted Bevilacqua... he’s ina white pick-up truck. Potential hostage situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter winds his way through the maze of Christmas trees. rounding a corner... where he runs into DANA.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Walter...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Hey. Bud arrives next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Is everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Come with us. She takes his hand and they move north back toward the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE PICK-UP drives south down I-95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua has his hands on the stee g wheel... Arthur’s left arm extended due to the hand-cu

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: (delirious ) Did you push the button... or was it your wife?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: My wife.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Yeah... me too. I wasn’t even home. She decided to push it when I wasn’t around to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: And now she’s dead. Did you kill her?

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me? Bevilacqua retrieves a NASA DOSSIER from the dashboard an hands it to Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Kenneth Weller. You know him?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Name sounds familiar. Does he work at Langley too?

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Yep. He’s next. Him and his wife... they've got the box now. Suddenly... BLUE AND RED LIGHTS appear behind them... followed by the sound of a SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: TWO POLICE CRUISERS are now tailing the pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua steps on the gas... accelerating to outrun the  we 92.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: I‘m not gonna let them get me... Arthur... we’ve got to get to Kenneth Weller. We've got to break the chain... or your wife is gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: How is she going to die?

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: you're going to kill her! Bevilacqua swerves into the ONCOMING TRAFFIC LANE to pass car in front of them. A LARGE 18-WHEELER TRUCK is barreli toward them. Bevilacqua pulls the truck back into the right lane.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: The 18 WHEELER slams on the brakes... then jack-knives to the left... blocking both lanes... One of the POLICE CRUISERS pulls off into the ditch... wh the second CRUISER swerves and SMASHES head on into the s of the truck bed... sheering the top of the sedan into tw pieces...

dialogues.speaker: INT, WHITE PICK-UP TRUCK
dialogues.text: Arthur looks back over his shoulder... seeing the cars sm together.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Jesus! You’re gonna get us killed!

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Did Steward take you to the library? Did you meet his mother... the librarian?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Did she tell you about Prometheus?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah...  93.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA
dialogues.text: Steward has a twin brother... and he works for the CIA. UP AHEAD... Arthur sees FOUR MORE POLICE CRUISERS with th lights flashing. They have formed a ROADBLOCK. Bevilacqua lowers his foot onto the accelerator... refusi to back down.

dialogues.speaker: BEVILACQUA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is purgatory... we're living in purgatory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE TRUCK smashes through the line of POLICE CRUISE as POLICE OFFICERS dive for cover. An Officer raises his GUN and fires off several rounds to the truck. A BULLET explodes the right front tire... The truck swerves and FLIPS OVER onto one side... tumblin over and over along the interstate in a horrific crash. ONCOMING CARS swerve into ditches... and the white truck comes sliding to a stop on the wet pavement. The CAMERA slowly approaches the smoking wreckage... catc a glimpse of Bevilacqua... his face covered in blood. Art remains hidden from sight.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, VIRGINIA HOUSE
dialogues.text: Norma rushes down the sidewalk on the perimeter of the square... searching for her son.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Walter? A BLACK SEDAN pulls up next co her... and Reston steps ou the car. Norma locks eyes with him... recognizing his face...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis? Norma Lewis?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Reston Steward. I work for the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Yeah? Where is my son? Where is my husband?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Please... get into the car. Norma stares at him in disbelief... as he opens the back and gestures inside.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gentle) Please... there isn’t much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Burns walks through the aftermath of the crash site. There are now several FIRE TRUCKS, AMBULANCES and other EMERGENCY VEHICLES scattered on either side of the interstate. Robert Bevilacqua’s DEAD BODY is now on a stretcher. Jim looks down at him briefly... then turns to another OFFICE the scene.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where's Arthur?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: They took him away in an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits up in the back of the ambulance. He has a sma scrape on his cheekbone... but otherwise appears unharmed An EMS TECHNICIAN is in there with him. He hands Arthur a ICE PACK.

dialogues.speaker: EMS TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Here... hold this against your forehead. It’ll keep your head from swelling. Arthur takes the ice pack and places it against his head.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Thanks.  95.

dialogues.speaker: EMS TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: I think it might have been a miracle. The EMS Technician shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EMS TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: That car accident. I’ve never seen someone walk away from an accident like that. (beat) : Somebody upstairs is looking out for you, buddy. The door to the ambulance opens. A US ARMY OFFICER appear He steps away from the doors and General Teague emerges f the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Are you able to walk, son?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Please step out of the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur steps out of the ambulance and sees that it is par in front of a HOWARD JOHNSON HOTEL on an exit of I-95. Th hotel has a DINER attached to it. There are more than a dozen POLICE CARS parked in front, along with,several BLACK SEDANS and MILITARY VEHICLES. Arthur hears the rumble of a HELICOPTER circling the sky above them. Its SEARCHLIGET sweeps through the forest. In front of the diner entrance... more than a DOZEN MEN operate VIDEO CAMERAS and STILL CAMERAS mounted on tripod all pointed toward the front window of the diner. Teague is standing with Cahill and Reston, along with sev other MILITARY PERSONNEL. Arthur notices Norma as she emerges from a BLACK SEDAN... looks exhausted... delirious.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Arthur!  96.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Norma! She hugs him... neither has slept in two days.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Where’s Walter?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Reston steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: My brother has taken your son... put he assures me that he is alive and well. Reston tries to comfort them with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a walk with us. Norma and Arthur begin to walk with Reston, Teague and Ca toward the diner entrance.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with the myth of Prometheus?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: In the 1940s... when NASA was formed, we began developing, in secret, a project that we dubbed the Prometheus Effect.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Projecting fictional scenarios about how we would respond, if and when we came into contact with an alien intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: If the intelligence had hostile intent... oz if it began to somehow display proof of its ability to destroy us, we would have a system in place to begin negotiating with it in secret.  37.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: The goal of Prometheus is to maintain coexistence with this life- form, and eventually achieve peace with it, so that its power can be harnessed, developed and applied in such a manner that will ben t the human race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur notices that Cahill is holding a folder in his rig hand.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: On the night of September 3rd, as the server was downloading images from the Viking camera system that you helped design... we experienced an electrical surge from a bolt of lightning. As they arrive at the entrance to the diner, Cahill shows Arthur a blurry black and white photograph.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: An anomaly in the series of Viking images produced this photograph of the Mars surface. The photo appears to be a ghost-like TRAIL OF WHITE LIGHT streaking across the Martian landscape. Teague nods toward the diner window.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: According to... it... and whatever it is... Arthur notices Arlington sitting alone in a booth inside diner... waiting...

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A ghost... an apparition... a methane compound imbedded in pulse of electricity...

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: If the human spirit is assigned a specific bandwidth upon conception... twins... would provide it with a dual bandwidth carrier...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: (interrupting) It claims to be mcre than six billion years old.  98. Arthur stares at the streak of white light in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: My camera... took this. photo...

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: Weve run the data sequence off the server more than a thousand times. Each time... this one photo in the sequence comes out of the dark room just like this. We can’t explain why. Arthur hands the photo back to Cahill.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: What does it want? Cahill glances at Teague... who looks to Cahill.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: I think the same thing that it wanted from Bevilacqua... except that poor boy is no longer around to tell us why he shot his wife.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: What did he say to you when you were in the car with him?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Something about breaking the chain. He wanted to find the next test subject... and prevent them from pushing the button. Cahill is writing diligently on his NOTE PAD. Reston can now feel something taking control of him... he looks to Teague... terrified. He closes his eyes... his body begins to twitch. Teague stares at his friend... realizing what is happenin Reston opens his eyes... now possessed... blood draining his ears.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: General Teague... it’s a pleasure to meet you. (beat) I would like to continue with my experiment... if you don’t mind. Reston smiles at the General.  99.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please do not interfere... as I assure you that if you do... there will be dire consequences... Reston then turns to face Arthur and Norma.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time is of the essence... and I'd like to invite my guests inside. Reston opens the door to the diner and gestures to Arthur Norma for them to come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, Norma and Reston make their way down the long ais of the diner, flanked by a row of booths, across from a l LUNCH COUNTER with a metal surface. Arlington sits alone in a booth. He pivots his head aroun face them.

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Please have a seat. Reston sits down next to his twin brother... Arthur and N sit down across from the twins. Arlington has now locked completely into his brother's spirit... The movement of the two men is in now in PERFECT SYNCHRONICITY, staggered by exactly one second... Reston following Arlington. Arlington's eyes remain closed in deep concentration... Arlington's lips move silently... and Reston repeats them loud. Reston’s demeanor is now kind... gentle... almost apologetic for his past behavior.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Don't be frightened by my manner of communication... but it is becoming more difficult for me to speak, given my body's... condition. NORMA. What have you done with our son?  100.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON /ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: We'll get to him in a moment... but first I want you tc know that I have a deep respect and admiration you both, and I am very sorry... that you pushed the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud now has Walter laid out on the cement next the edge o the SWIMMING POOL at the shallow end. The boy is unconscious... still dressed in his suit from the wedding From across the pool... Dana is squatting on the end of t DIVING BOARD... watching them. Bud then removes Walter’s right shoe and sock... exposing bare foot. He then retrieves a SERRATED HUNTING KNIFE... cuts in the flesh from his BIG TOE across the ball of his foot... drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston closes his eyes for a moment. When he opens them.. tears have begun to form, as though he cannot bear the ne that his brother is forcing him to deliver.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: I will now give you a chance to save yourselves... an opportunity for redemption and salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is now carrying the unconscious Walter in his arms. H steps into the shallow end of the heated pool... and dunk the boy under the surface. BLOOD from the cut on the bottom of his foot drains out i the water like red ink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma closes her eyes... the impending sense of dread building inside of her.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Two of your son’s five functional senses have been permanently impaired.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER... Walter floats with his arms spread wide... WHITE STROBES OF LIGHT FLICKER AROUND HIM. The light stre bear a close resemblance to the image in the Mars photo. Blood streams out from his foot into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood is now flowing out of Reston’s left nostril. Both Arthur and Norma recoil in horror.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON /ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: He is now blind and deaf. (beat) For the rest of his life, he will never hear your voice... or see your face.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Why...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON /ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: You are now presented with two options. (beat) Option one... you enjoy the rest of your lives with the money you have been given, and you learn to live with your son's disability. Reston then reaches into his pocket and retrieves a PISTO He places it on the table next to the box.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then there is option number two. (beat) There is one bullet in the chamber of this gun. Reston slides the gun across the table in Arthur's direct

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can fire this bullet into your wife’s heart... killing her. (beat) At the exact moment that her spirit departs the earth, this curse upon your son will be reversed, and both of his impaired senses will instantaneously return to normal.  Se 102. Arthur looks over at Norma in disbelief... then back at t twins. He cannot fathom how it has now come to this.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arthur, you will then be arrested and charged with the murder of your wife... and the money will be placed in an interest bearing trust for your son to receive upon his eighteenth birthday.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: That's not fair. (beat) Let me do it. I pushed your stupid button. If I deserve to be punished for it... then let me kill myself. Arthur has nothing to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON /ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but the offer is not negotiable. (to Arthur) And if Norma’s fincers so much as touch the weapon at any point from this moment on... the restoration of Walter’s sight and sound will be denied.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: If Arthur has to do it... then I want you to make it look like a suicide. Arthur shouldn’t be punished for something that I did.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... but the terms of the offer are not negotiable. Arthur faces has gone completely white.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Is there an afterlife? The twins smile cryptically in response to Arthur's quest

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because this is purgatory, right? The earth is purgatory... and you're here to start shutting things down... right? The twins appear impressed with his foresight.  103.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: I find your theory to be quite fascinating. But I must remind you that I am unable to disclose the identity of my employers. Arthur glances out the window at all of the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Right. I get it. Reston then turns to the window...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Can someone please bring up the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma emerge from the diner in a state of delirium. A SOLDIER pulls up in Arthur’s TRANS-AM. He ste out of the car and holds the door open. Teague and Cahill approach... as MEN in dark suits snap hundreds of photographs of the couple. Cahill puts his hand on Arthur's shoulder... searching fo words. Teague glances inside the diner... then back at Arthur. Arthur nods his head slowly... his mind lost... and he li toward the car with Norma at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma sits behind the wheel... allowing Arthur to ride shotgun. He looks weakened by the whole ordeal, and she i afraid he might pass out.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn’t happening, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: This isn’t happening... She starts the engine... and they drive off. Arthur watches the parking lot full of MEN reflected back them in the side-view mirror.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SHOT: The CAMERA flies over 1-95 as Arthur's c travels north toward Richmond, A MILITARY HELICOPTER flie overhead... escorting them on their journey home. INT. ARTHUR’S CAR -- NEXT Arthur sits shotgun as Norma drives them home. They have riding in silence for quite some time now, having reached level of complete mental and physical exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: All these years... I’ve given you the impression that Walter was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah... and?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: And... it wasn't exactly an accident. (beat) I stopped taking the pill when I met you...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Because I was so afraid of losing you to someone prettier than me. Arthur just stares at her... unsure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For that alone... I deserve a bullet in the heart... don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No... I don’t. She manages a smile. A tear rolls down her cheek as she stares out at the pavement and the endless trees lining either side of the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pulls the car up into the driveway. The street is quiet and empty.  105. They step out of the car. Dana is sitting on the front po waiting for them. She rises to her feet as they approach.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Did my dad tell you why he loves you, Norma? Norma realizes that she has been involved all along. Bloo drains from her nose.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Because you're an amputee. He says that the soul of an amputee leaks out into the wind... searching for the place where there is no longer flesh and bone. (beat) It says that the soul that leaks is the soul that endures. It is the kindest and bravest soul of them all.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Where is our son?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: He's locked in the upstairs bathroom. I think he just woke up. Dana turns away... and begins to walk down the sidewalk i the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter lays inside the bathtub, soaking wet. He is still wearing his suit from the wedding. He is shivering... loo around... disoriented... His EYE-BALLS are now COMPLETELY WHITE... pupils no longe visible.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is anyone’ there?! He begins clawing at the walls... trying to figure out wh he is.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t see!  106. He climbs out of the bathtub and begins to crawl across t tile floor. He runs into the door... and then reaches up finds the DOORKNOB. It is locked. He begins to bang on the door relentlessly.

dialogues.speaker: INT, LEWIS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur come up the stairs and round the corner the hallway. Walter's HAND reaches out through the crack beneath the door. Norma tries to open the door but there is a MASSIVE LOCK installed on it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Walter! Norma reaches down and takes her son’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Who’s there?! Who’s there?!

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Walter! It’s mom! Can you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not respond... and begins banging his head agains the door... harder and harder... Thump... thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response... just his head... slamming against the door repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: We need to kick the door down.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: He could get hurt...  107. Norma begins to pound back on the door with her fist... a eventually the thumping stops. She begins to hear guiet s from inside the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Who's there? Who’s there? Norma rises to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Come downstairs, Arthur. She takes his left hand... as he clutches Walter’s hand i his right.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arthur... (beat) I need you to come downstairs with me... right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZANNE WELLER (30s) sits on her bed. Her husband KENNETH WELLER (30s) stands at the window. Neither looks like the have slept in a while. Suzanne has the box sitting on the mattress in front of her... the glass dome is open.

dialogues.speaker: SUZANNE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna push it.

dialogues.speaker: INT, LEWIS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma stand across from one another in the kitchen. Arthur holds the GUN in his right hand... and he slowly limps over to his wife and takes her into his arms

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Norma...

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Arthur... I love you, and I’m so sorry... I’m so sorry that I did this to us...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm the one who told you to push the button... so don’t apologize. He looks out through the window at his back yard... likel for the last time.  Se

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you too... and please know... that I regret nothing in this life we’ve lived together.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting... counting the days until my Arthur comes to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne Weller smiles at her husband... reaches her finge out and places it on the button. . She then presses down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM UPSTAIRS... thump... thump... their son's head bangi against the door...

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: It’s going to be harder for you to live than for me to die. Arthur closes his eyes... the noise is excruciating. Ther no time to wait any longer.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Well then. (beat) Let's get on with it. Arthur kisses her... then steps back... still clutching h hand... raises the gun... and fires off a round into her heart. Norma collapses... Arthur falls with her... breaking her with his arms as they collapse into a heap onto the linol floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne looks over at her husband and lets out a deranged giggle. He smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks down into his wife's eyes as the life drains from her body. Seconds later... Norma is dead.  109. BLOOD begins to flow from the exit wound in her back acro the linoleum. Arthur is now covered in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter crawls across the blood-soaked kitchen floor and reaches up to the PHONE that is mounted on the wall. He t his finger and places it in the cradle... dials 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks along a series of CUBICLES at the POLIC STATION in downtown Richmond. An OPERATOR sits at each cubicle... each one female.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: 911 emergency... how may I direct your call? The CAMERA moves in closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur has the phone to his ear... imprints of his wife's plood are smeared on the phone’s receiver.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yes. This is Arthur Lewis at 1560 Monument Avenue. I’ve just shot my wife... can you please send an ambulance? The Operator begins to ask more. questions... but Arthur not listen. He hangs up the phone. The thumping from upstairs has now subsided.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He pulls himself to his feet and heads into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur rounds the corner at the base of the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur rounds the corner of the upstairs hallway... rushe toward the bathroom door. Walter's hand comes sliding out from beneath the crack in door. Arthur grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yes... can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What do you see? Where are you Walter?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I’m in the bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Can you see clearly?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yeah... I can see... everything is bright... but I can see.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Everything is bright. Everything is bright Walter... you're gonna be okay, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay, buddy. That's all that matters. (beat) That's all that matters, now. Out of the corner of his eye, Arthur notices something at top of the stairs. It is a POLICE OFFICER. He has his gun aimed at Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: YOUR HANDS ON YOUR HEAD
dialogues.text: lil. Arthur stares at the officer... frozen... the repercussio of his decision now stare him in the face with a loaded g

dialogues.speaker: PUT YOUR HANDS ON YOUR HEAD
dialogues.text: Arthur obeys... and the cop rushes over and pushes him ov onto his stomach... handcuffing his wrists together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL rings. Suzanne Weller opens the door. Arlington is standing ther with his briefcase... smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ARLINGTON
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weller... do you have the button unit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CORONER places a BLANKET over Norma’s face as the house sealed off by various CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATORS and other police.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, LEWIS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Arthur is now being escorted by two POLICE OFFICERS to a waiting CRUISER that is parked in front of the house. Jim Burns is standing there with the door open.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry, Jim. He stares Arthur down as he is put into the back seat of cruiser. Jim closes the door and goes around to the front the car. Jim gets behind the wheel and starts the engine. Arthur looks back through the window, toward his house. Upstairs in the MASTER BEDROOM WINDOW... Walter is watchi tears streaming down his face. Arthur reaches up with his hands... cuffed together... an tries his best to wave at his son.  ee 112.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mouthing silertly) I'm sorry... From the window... Walter watches the car pull away from curb. He places his hand on the glass... waving back.
